category.name: anomalous
category.desc: These prime field curves have the same order as the field order. Some are from https://dspace.jaist.ac.jp/dspace/bitstream/10119/4464/1/73-61.pdf.

category.name: brainpool
category.desc: ECC Brainpool Standard Curves and Curve Generation v. 1.0 19.10.2005

category.name: nist
category.desc: RECOMMENDED ELLIPTIC CURVES FOR FEDERAL GOVERNMENT USE July 1999

category.name: secg
category.desc: SEC 2: Recommended Elliptic Curve Domain Parameters version 2.0 January 27, 2010

category.name: anssi
category.desc: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d'information: Publication d'un paramétrage de courbe elliptique visant des applications de passeport électronique et de l'administration électronique française. 21 November 2011

category.name: x962
category.desc: ANSI X9.62 example curves.

category.name: Barreto-Naehrig
category.desc: Barreto-Naehrig curves from: A Family of Implementation-Friendly BN Elliptic Curves - https://eprint.iacr.org/2010/429.pdf.

category.name: MNT
category.desc: MNT (Miyaji, Nakabayashi, and Takano) example curves from: New explicit conditions of elliptic curve traces for FR-reduction - https://dspace.jaist.ac.jp/dspace/bitstream/10119/4432/1/73-48.pdf.

category.name: other
category.desc: An assortment of some other curves.

category.name: invalid
category.desc: Invalid curves and points on them for common standard named curves.

category.name: twist
category.desc: Points on quadratic twists of common standard named curves.

category.name: degenerate
category.desc: Points on degenerate curves for common standard named curves.

category.name: cofactor
category.desc: Curves of order n * p, with p prime and n in {2,4,8,16,32,64,128}. Generator of order p, with points on the subgroup of order n.

category.name: composite
category.desc: Composite order curves, with points of very small order pre-generated. Also curves with order of a product of two large primes.

category.name: wrong
category.desc: Wrong field curves and other wrong parameters. These should definitely give an error when used. Since the "prime" used for the field is not prime, and the field polynomials are also not irreducible. Simply put these parameters don't specify a valid elliptic curve.

category.name: test
category.desc: Test vectors

category.name: wycheproof
category.desc: Test cases from google Wycheproof project: https://github.com/google/wycheproof

category.name: supersingular
category.desc: Some supersingular curves, over F_p with order equal to p + 1.

category.name: misc
category.desc: Miscellaneous data.
